description.narrative: Children drink safe water, use adequate sanitation and practice good hygiene, and promote healthy environments

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children drink safe water, use adequate sanitation and practice good hygiene, and promote healthy environments

description.narrative: Efforts in 2017 focused on adaptation of the 2030 WASH agenda to country specific contexts. Key achievements: (i) 24 countries validated baselines for targets 6.1 (drinking water) and 6.2 (sanitation), (ii) nine countries assessed national monitoring systems for SDG readiness, (iii) WASH SDG Financing studies completed in six countries. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: # of countries implementing a sustainability Compact for WASH with evidence of continuous monitoring
# of peer reviewed journal publications on WASH
# of key regional WASH initiatives & platforms in which UNICEF is co-chair or provides coordination support
# of countries implementing a national strategy to eliminate open defecation
# countries in humanitarian action where country cluster or sector coordination mechanism for WASH meet CCC standards for coordination.
# countries with national monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services
